sixOfSwords.uprightMeaning: The Six of Swords shows a boat carrying passengers from rough to calm waters—transition and moving on. This card indicates leaving difficulties behind, necessary transitions, and the journey toward peace. Though the journey may be somber, calmer waters lie ahead.
sixOfSwords.reversedMeaning: Reversed suggests inability to move on, returning to old difficulties, or delayed transitions. The journey may be blocked or circular.
sixOfSwords.loveMeaning: Moving on from relationship difficulties. Transitioning out of troubled partnerships. Healing journey in love.
sixOfSwords.careerMeaning: Career transition, leaving toxic work environments, or moving toward more peaceful professional waters.
sixOfSwords.affirmation: I move forward toward calmer waters.

sevenOfSwords.name: Seven of Swords
sevenOfSwords.information: The Seven of Swords represents strategy, deception, and the need for careful, sometimes covert action.
sevenOfSwords.uprightMeaning: The Seven of Swords shows a figure sneaking away with stolen swords—strategy, deception, or getting away with something. This card indicates cunning action, sometimes necessary and sometimes unethical. Be aware of deception around you, or examine your own motivations for secretive behavior.
sevenOfSwords.reversedMeaning: Reversed suggests being caught in deception, conscience about dishonesty, or someone's true colors being revealed. Time for truth.
sevenOfSwords.loveMeaning: Secrets or deception in relationships. Hidden agendas. Need for honesty or uncovering partner's truth.
sevenOfSwords.careerMeaning: Strategic maneuvering at work, office politics, or dishonesty in business. Protect yourself while staying ethical.
sevenOfSwords.affirmation: I act strategically while honoring my integrity.

eightOfSwords.name: Eight of Swords
eightOfSwords.information: The Eight of Swords symbolizes mental imprisonment, self-imposed restrictions, and the power of limiting beliefs.
eightOfSwords.uprightMeaning: The Eight of Swords shows a bound and blindfolded figure surrounded by swords—yet the bonds are loose and escape is possible. This card indicates feeling trapped by circumstances or thoughts that are actually self-imposed. Your prison exists primarily in your mind. Remove the blindfold and see freedom is closer than you think.
eightOfSwords.reversedMeaning: Reversed suggests breaking free from mental prison, releasing limiting beliefs, or finally seeing a way out. Liberation from self-imposed restrictions.
eightOfSwords.loveMeaning: Feeling trapped in relationship patterns. Self-limiting beliefs about love. Recognizing you have more options than you see.
eightOfSwords.careerMeaning: Feeling stuck in career, self-imposed professional limitations, or breaking free from restrictive work situations.
eightOfSwords.affirmation: I release the mental bonds that imprison me.

nineOfSwords.name: Nine of Swords
nineOfSwords.information: The Nine of Swords represents anxiety, nightmares, and mental anguish, often worse than reality warrants.
nineOfSwords.uprightMeaning: The Nine of Swords shows a figure waking from nightmare, head in hands—anxiety, fear, and mental anguish. This card indicates worry that keeps you up at night, often worse than reality warrants. The nine swords represent thoughts, not facts. Much of what you fear may never come to pass.
nineOfSwords.reversedMeaning: Reversed may indicate releasing anxiety, finding peace after worry, or finally addressing fears. Alternatively, inner turmoil hidden from others.
nineOfSwords.loveMeaning: Anxiety about relationships, fears about love, or nightmares about partnership. Often the worry exceeds the reality.
nineOfSwords.careerMeaning: Work-related stress causing sleepless nights. Professional anxiety. Time to address fears or recognize they are overblown.
nineOfSwords.affirmation: I release anxiety and trust in peaceful resolution.

tenOfSwords.name: Ten of Swords
tenOfSwords.information: The Ten of Swords represents painful endings, rock bottom, but also the dawn of new beginnings after crisis.
tenOfSwords.uprightMeaning: The Ten of Swords shows a figure with ten swords in their back—but dawn breaks on the horizon. This card indicates painful endings, rock bottom, and the culmination of crisis. Yet it cannot get worse; the only way is up. Accept the ending; the worst is behind you, and new light approaches.
tenOfSwords.reversedMeaning: Reversed suggests recovery from crisis, resisting inevitable endings, or slowly healing from deep wounds. The darkest hour is passing.
tenOfSwords.loveMeaning: Painful relationship endings, betrayal, or reaching the lowest point in love. Yet healing and new love can follow.
tenOfSwords.careerMeaning: Career crisis, professional betrayal, or hitting rock bottom at work. The only way is up from here.
tenOfSwords.affirmation: Even at rock bottom, I see the dawn approaching.

daughterOfSwords.name: Daughter of Swords
daughterOfSwords.information: The Daughter of Swords represents intellectual curiosity, new ways of thinking, and messages of truth.
daughterOfSwords.uprightMeaning: The Daughter of Swords holds her sword high, ready for truth—intellectual curiosity and new ways of thinking are emerging. This card indicates messages, new ideas, and the beginning of mental endeavors. Stay alert and vigilant; truth is seeking to be discovered.
daughterOfSwords.reversedMeaning: Reversed suggests scattered thoughts, gossip, or using intellect unwisely. Messages may be misleading or communication problematic.
daughterOfSwords.loveMeaning: New communications about love, truth-seeking in relationships, or a young, intellectually curious admirer.
daughterOfSwords.careerMeaning: News about work, intellectual opportunities, or beginning of new mental challenges. Stay sharp.
daughterOfSwords.affirmation: I seek truth with sharp, curious intellect.

sonOfSwords.name: Son of Swords
sonOfSwords.information: The Son of Swords symbolizes swift action, ambitious pursuit of goals, and sometimes hasty decisions.
sonOfSwords.uprightMeaning: The Son of Swords charges forward on his horse—swift action, ambition, and fearless pursuit of goals. This card indicates driving forward with mental energy, tackling challenges head-on, and fast-paced change. Act decisively, but avoid reckless haste.
sonOfSwords.reversedMeaning: Reversed suggests recklessness, all talk and no action, or scattered energy. Hasty decisions may cause problems.
sonOfSwords.loveMeaning: Fast-moving romance, assertive pursuit of love, or rushing into relationships. Slow down if needed.
sonOfSwords.careerMeaning: Ambitious career moves, fast-paced professional action, or driving toward goals with determination.
sonOfSwords.affirmation: I act swiftly and decisively toward my goals.

motherOfSwords.name: Mother of Swords
motherOfSwords.information: The Mother of Swords embodies independence, clear perception, and direct communication of truth.
motherOfSwords.uprightMeaning: The Mother of Swords sits on her throne, sword raised, seeing clearly—independent judgment and direct truth. This card represents the ability to perceive situations clearly, set strong boundaries, and communicate with precision. She speaks truth without cruelty but without softening it either.
motherOfSwords.reversedMeaning: Reversed may indicate coldness, cruelty with words, or harsh judgment. Alternatively, not speaking truth when needed.
motherOfSwords.loveMeaning: Clear boundaries in relationships, direct communication about needs, or an independent partner. Beware of coldness.
motherOfSwords.careerMeaning: Direct professional communication, clear judgment in work matters, and boundary-setting with colleagues.
motherOfSwords.affirmation: I speak truth clearly while respecting others.

fatherOfSwords.name: Father of Swords
fatherOfSwords.information: The Father of Swords symbolizes intellectual mastery, authority based on truth, and the power of clear judgment.
fatherOfSwords.uprightMeaning: The Father of Swords commands from his throne—intellectual authority and mastery of truth. This card represents the power to discern clearly, judge fairly, and communicate with authority. He leads with mind rather than heart, sometimes to the point of coldness, but always with clarity.
fatherOfSwords.reversedMeaning: Reversed indicates abuse of intellectual power, manipulation through logic, or tyrannical authority. Cold judgment without compassion.
fatherOfSwords.loveMeaning: Intellectual partner, clear communication in relationships, or analyzing love logically. Beware of emotional disconnect.
fatherOfSwords.careerMeaning: Authority through expertise, leadership requiring clear judgment, and mastery of professional domain.
fatherOfSwords.affirmation: I lead with clarity, truth, and fair judgment.

aceOfWands.name: Ace of Wands
aceOfWands.information: The Ace of Wands represents the spark of inspiration, creative potential, and new beginnings filled with passionate energy.
aceOfWands.uprightMeaning: The Ace of Wands bursts forth with creative fire—inspiration, new beginnings, and raw potential. A hand holds a blossoming wand, representing the seed of a passionate venture. This is the spark that starts the fire. Seize this creative energy and channel it into action.
aceOfWands.reversedMeaning: Reversed indicates creative blocks, false starts, or lack of direction. The spark may be present but not catching fire. Examine what is blocking your creative flow.
aceOfWands.loveMeaning: New passionate romance, creative approach to love, or spark of attraction. Exciting new beginnings in relationships.
aceOfWands.careerMeaning: Inspiring new project, creative venture, or entrepreneurial spark. Time to pursue passionate work.
aceOfWands.affirmation: I ignite my creative potential with passionate action.

twoOfWands.name: Two of Wands
twoOfWands.information: The Two of Wands symbolizes planning for the future, making decisions about direction, and holding the world in your hands.
twoOfWands.uprightMeaning: The Two of Wands shows a figure holding the world, looking out from a castle—planning, decisions, and future vision. The initial spark has caught; now comes strategic thinking about where to direct your fire. The world awaits; choose your direction wisely.
twoOfWands.reversedMeaning: Reversed indicates fear of the unknown, poor planning, or lacking vision. You may be staying in your comfort zone rather than expanding.
twoOfWands.loveMeaning: Planning future with partner, deciding about relationship direction, or considering romantic options.
twoOfWands.careerMeaning: Career planning, considering opportunities, and strategic professional thinking. The world is open to you.
twoOfWands.affirmation: I plan my future with vision and strategic purpose.

threeOfWands.name: Three of Wands
threeOfWands.information: The Three of Wands represents expansion, watching plans unfold, and opportunities arriving from afar.
threeOfWands.uprightMeaning: The Three of Wands shows a figure watching ships approach—plans are unfolding, expansion is underway. This card indicates progress, foresight paying off, and opportunities arriving. Your efforts are beginning to bear fruit; continue to think big.
threeOfWands.reversedMeaning: Reversed suggests delays in plans, obstacles to expansion, or disappointing returns on efforts. Patience may be needed.
threeOfWands.loveMeaning: Relationship expansion, long-distance love, or watching partnership grow. Planning future together.
threeOfWands.careerMeaning: Business expansion, international opportunities, and watching career plans unfold successfully.
threeOfWands.affirmation: My vision expands as opportunities arrive.

fourOfWands.name: Four of Wands
fourOfWands.information: The Four of Wands symbolizes celebration, achievement of milestones, and joyous community gatherings.
fourOfWands.uprightMeaning: The Four of Wands depicts celebration under a flower-adorned canopy—milestones achieved, community gathered in joy. This card indicates celebration, harmony, and the happiness of homecoming. Take time to celebrate your achievements with loved ones.
fourOfWands.reversedMeaning: Reversed may indicate cancelled celebrations, lack of harmony, or feeling like an outsider. Home life may need attention.
fourOfWands.loveMeaning: Relationship milestones, engagement, wedding celebration, or joyous partnership achievements.
fourOfWands.careerMeaning: Work celebrations, team achievements, and professional milestones worthy of recognition.
fourOfWands.affirmation: I celebrate my achievements with joyous community.

fiveOfWands.name: Five of Wands
fiveOfWands.information: The Five of Wands represents conflict, competition, and the challenges of working with diverse perspectives.
fiveOfWands.uprightMeaning: The Five of Wands shows figures in chaotic combat—conflict, competition, and clashing egos. This card indicates disagreement, rivalry, and the struggle of diverse opinions. While challenging, this competition can sharpen your skills. Channel the energy constructively.
fiveOfWands.reversedMeaning: Reversed suggests conflict resolution, avoiding confrontation, or internal rather than external struggle. Peace may be possible.
fiveOfWands.loveMeaning: Relationship conflicts, competing for attention, or power struggles in partnership. Work toward resolution.
fiveOfWands.careerMeaning: Workplace competition, conflicting ideas, and professional rivalry. Stand your ground while remaining collaborative.
fiveOfWands.affirmation: I navigate conflict constructively and grow stronger.

sixOfWands.name: Six of Wands
sixOfWands.information: The Six of Wands symbolizes victory, public recognition, and the celebration of achievement.
sixOfWands.uprightMeaning: The Six of Wands shows a victor on horseback, crowned with laurels, celebrated by crowds—victory and public recognition. This card indicates success, acclaim, and the sweet taste of achievement. Your efforts are recognized; accept the praise graciously.
sixOfWands.reversedMeaning: Reversed suggests lack of recognition, hollow victory, or fall from grace. Success may be delayed or unacknowledged.
sixOfWands.loveMeaning: Relationship success, feeling victorious in love, or public celebration of partnership.
sixOfWands.careerMeaning: Professional recognition, career victory, and public acclaim for achievements. Success is celebrated.
sixOfWands.affirmation: I accept recognition for my achievements with grace.

sevenOfWands.name: Seven of Wands
sevenOfWands.information: The Seven of Wands represents defending your position, standing your ground against opposition, and perseverance.
sevenOfWands.uprightMeaning: The Seven of Wands shows a figure defending high ground against attackers—standing firm under pressure. This card indicates the need to defend your position, persevere against opposition, and maintain your ground. You have the advantage; do not give it up.
sevenOfWands.reversedMeaning: Reversed suggests giving up, being overwhelmed by opposition, or choosing not to fight. Sometimes retreat is wisdom.
sevenOfWands.loveMeaning: Defending relationship, fighting for love, or standing ground on relationship values.
sevenOfWands.careerMeaning: Defending professional position, workplace challenges, and perseverance against competition.
sevenOfWands.affirmation: I stand my ground with courage and conviction.

eightOfWands.name: Eight of Wands
eightOfWands.information: The Eight of Wands symbolizes rapid movement, swift progress, and things moving quickly toward completion.
eightOfWands.uprightMeaning: The Eight of Wands shows wands flying through clear sky—rapid movement and swift progress. This card indicates things moving quickly, momentum building, and actions bearing fruit fast. Strike while the iron is hot; delays are over.
eightOfWands.reversedMeaning: Reversed suggests delays, miscommunication, or arrows falling short. Momentum may be blocked or scattered.
eightOfWands.loveMeaning: Fast-moving romance, travel for love, or rapid developments in relationships.
eightOfWands.careerMeaning: Swift career progress, quick turnaround on projects, and momentum in professional matters.
eightOfWands.affirmation: I move swiftly toward my goals with clear direction.

nineOfWands.name: Nine of Wands
nineOfWands.information: The Nine of Wands represents resilience, courage in the face of adversity, and persistence near the finish line.
nineOfWands.uprightMeaning: The Nine of Wands shows a wounded figure still standing guard—resilience after battle, persistence despite weariness. This card indicates you are near the end but must stay strong. One more challenge remains; do not give up now. Protect your boundaries.
nineOfWands.reversedMeaning: Reversed suggests exhaustion, giving up too soon, or stubbornness. Know when to rest and when to release.
nineOfWands.loveMeaning: Persisting in love despite challenges, protecting relationship boundaries, or feeling battle-weary in partnership.
nineOfWands.careerMeaning: Career resilience, persistence near goals, and maintaining professional boundaries under pressure.
nineOfWands.affirmation: I persist with courage; the finish line is near.

tenOfWands.name: Ten of Wands
tenOfWands.information: The Ten of Wands symbolizes heavy burdens, overwhelming responsibility, and the weight of success.
tenOfWands.uprightMeaning: The Ten of Wands shows a figure bent under the weight of ten heavy wands—burden, responsibility, and hard work. This card indicates carrying too much, feeling overwhelmed by obligations, or success creating new burdens. Delegate or release what you can; the load is too heavy.
tenOfWands.reversedMeaning: Reversed suggests releasing burdens, learning to delegate, or collapse under weight. Time to set things down.
tenOfWands.loveMeaning: Relationship burdens, carrying too much for partner, or overwhelmed by love responsibilities.
tenOfWands.careerMeaning: Work overload, taking on too much responsibility, and career stress from success.
tenOfWands.affirmation: I release what I cannot carry and accept help.

daughterOfWands.name: Daughter of Wands
daughterOfWands.information: The Daughter of Wands represents the spark of adventure, enthusiastic new beginnings, and free-spirited exploration.
daughterOfWands.uprightMeaning: The Daughter of Wands gazes at her wand with wonder and excitement—new adventures, enthusiastic beginnings, and free-spirited exploration. This card indicates messages of inspiration, the beginning of passionate ventures, and youthful excitement for life.
daughterOfWands.reversedMeaning: Reversed suggests scattered energy, blocked creativity, or lack of direction. The enthusiasm may be unfocused.
daughterOfWands.loveMeaning: Exciting new romantic interest, adventurous approach to love, or passionate messages about relationships.
daughterOfWands.careerMeaning: Inspiring new project, creative opportunity, or enthusiastic beginning of career venture.
daughterOfWands.affirmation: I embrace adventure with enthusiasm and wonder.

sonOfWands.name: Son of Wands
sonOfWands.information: The Son of Wands symbolizes passionate action, adventurous spirit, and charming boldness.
sonOfWands.uprightMeaning: The Son of Wands charges forward full of passion and adventure—bold action, charming energy, and fearless pursuit of desires. This card indicates taking action on passion, adventurous journeys, and charismatic drive. Act boldly but beware of impulsiveness.
sonOfWands.reversedMeaning: Reversed suggests recklessness, scattered energy, or all passion with no follow-through. Haste may cause problems.
sonOfWands.loveMeaning: Passionate pursuit of love, adventurous romance, or charming but potentially unreliable suitor.
sonOfWands.careerMeaning: Bold career moves, passionate professional pursuits, and action-oriented approach to work.
sonOfWands.affirmation: I pursue my passions with bold, directed action.

motherOfWands.name: Mother of Wands
motherOfWands.information: The Mother of Wands embodies confident warmth, vibrant energy, and determined independence.
motherOfWands.uprightMeaning: The Mother of Wands sits confidently with her sunflowers and black cat—vibrant, warm, and self-assured. This card represents confident leadership, determined pursuit of goals, and inspiring others with your passionate energy. Lead with warmth and authenticity.
motherOfWands.reversedMeaning: Reversed may indicate jealousy, domineering behavior, or confidence turning to arrogance. Fire needs proper direction.
motherOfWands.loveMeaning: Confident, passionate partner. Warmth and determination in relationships. Inspiring love through authentic self.
motherOfWands.careerMeaning: Charismatic professional leadership, inspiring others, and confident pursuit of career goals.
motherOfWands.affirmation: I lead with confident warmth and inspire others.

fatherOfWands.name: Father of Wands
fatherOfWands.information: The Father of Wands symbolizes visionary leadership, entrepreneurial drive, and bold pursuit of goals with honor.
fatherOfWands.uprightMeaning: The Father of Wands commands from his throne with salamander cape and wand—visionary leader, bold entrepreneur, and honorable pursuer of goals. This card represents mastery of fire energy: passionate leadership that inspires others while maintaining integrity.
fatherOfWands.reversedMeaning: Reversed indicates tyrannical leadership, ruthless ambition, or burning out. Fire without wisdom destroys.
fatherOfWands.loveMeaning: Passionate, visionary partner. Bold leadership in relationships. Beware of domination when reversed.
fatherOfWands.careerMeaning: Entrepreneurial success, visionary professional leadership, and bold pursuit of career vision.
fatherOfWands.affirmation: I lead with vision, passion, and honor.
